comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
"1887" - Crikey, that's an oldie and a goodie!  I wonder if it was a slip-of-the-pen for 1888?  Very easy to do at the start of the year.  There are multiple articles about the ORIZABA as Flagship for the Centennial Regatta in 1888 (on 27 January),  but none for 1887.

Hmmm ...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Indeed, I researched it to make sure because our records had 1887 as well. But IBERIA was flagship that year, so yes, your suggestion that it was mislabelled is more likely. And yes, I think we've all made that mistake eh? :P
But thanks for pointing out the inscription, I hadn't noticed it!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Just found another faint inscription including CENTENNIAL, see note bottom left.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/65669741@N08] Thanks you two! We have entered these details into our database records :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
I had forgotten all about this PhM Charles Kerry photo of the ORIZABA on the same day in 1888, identified three years ago.  So many ships, so little time ...
